context: Anybody remember the movie “The Forbin Project”?  US and Russia both built intelligent defense control systems, the US version was called Colossus (don’t remember the Russian system’s name) anyway the two machines discovered each other, exchanged information by forcing both countries to grant communications access, then decided that humans needed a caretaker.  I tend to agree that we need to tread very carefully when contemplating giving intelligence and reasoning skills to a machine that can think thousands of times faster than we can.  That is not a wise move.

replies.context:
I loved "The Forbin Project". Great acting from Braeden and Clark. Cameron could have at least given a nod to it in "The Terminator".
Watch it again and freak how the computer voice sounds so authoritarian like Trump's.

Nobody has ever made a movie where intelligent machines take over and create Nirvana.  If we cannot imagine such a scenario it is probably best not to create such a system until we can.  Every intelligent machine story ends badly for the makers of machines.

Nirvana for a machine is hell for a lifeform.
Just like Nirvana for a democrat is hell for humanity.
That’s only because intelligent and Democrat are an oxymoron.
